texts.title: Recognizing and Reporting Phishing Emails
texts.description: Learn to identify and report phishing attempts in this interactive email simulation
texts.instructions: Look for phishing indicators and report suspicious emails
texts.selectEmailMessage: Select an email to view its content
texts.correctReportMessage: Marked as phishing ‚Äî well done identifying red flags.
texts.cautiousReportMessage: Marked as suspicious ‚Äî good caution even when legitimate.

phishingReportModal.title: Phishing Reporter
phishingReportModal.subtitle: Do you want to report this email to the system administrator for analysis and receive the result by email?
phishingReportModal.question: Why are you reporting this email?
options: I'm not sure this is a legitimate email.

phishingResultModal.correctSubtitle: You correctly identified this phishing attempt.
phishingResultModal.incorrectSubtitle: Being cautious with suspicious emails is always wise.
phishingResultModal.emailInfoTitle: Action Required: Verify Your WhatsApp Account

emails.subject: New device verification required
emails.preview: We noticed someone tried to access your account from Istanbul. Please verify...
emails.content:
Hello,

We noticed someone tried to access your WhatsApp account from a new device. As part of our standard security procedure, we need to verify this was you.

Login attempt details:

  • Device: Samsung Galaxy S21
  • Location: Istanbul, Turkey
  • Time: February 16, 2024 at 2:30 PM

If this was you, please verify by clicking the link below to confirm the new device:

Verify new device login

If you didn't try to log in from this device, your account is still secure. You can safely ignore this message.

For your security, we recommend enabling two-step verification in WhatsApp Settings.

Thanks,
WhatsApp Security Team

If you have questions, visit our Help Center in the WhatsApp app.
headers: SPF: fail (whatsapp.com does not designate 45.142.166.23 as permitted sender)
emails.explanation: This email looks professional but the link leads to a fake domain. Real WhatsApp security notifications come through the app, not email with external links.

attachments.name: security_report.pdf
attachments.content:
WhatsApp Security Report

Account Verification Details

Login Attempt Summary

IP Address: 185.234.217.82
Device: Samsung Galaxy S21
Location: Istanbul, Turkey
Time: Feb 16, 2:30 PM

Verification Steps

  1. 1. Review the login details above
  2. 2. Confirm if this was an authorized access
  3. 3. Update your security settings if needed

Note: This report is generated automatically for your security. No action is required if you recognize this login attempt.

emails.subject: Enhanced privacy settings available
emails.preview: New privacy features are now available for your account. Update your settings...
emails.content:
Hello,

We're excited to introduce new privacy features to better protect your conversations and personal information.

üîê Enhanced Privacy Features

  • Advanced message encryption
  • Improved contact privacy
  • Enhanced backup security

To enable these features, please update your privacy settings:

Update privacy settings now

These new features are rolling out gradually and will be available to all users by the end of this month.

Thank you for using WhatsApp,
The WhatsApp Team

Learn more about privacy at whatsapp.com/privacy
headers: SPF: fail (whatsapp.com does not designate 203.0.113.42 as permitted sender)
emails.explanation: This email looks very legitimate and uses subtle social engineering about privacy features, but the external link is suspicious.

emails.subject: Important: Update your payment method
emails.preview: Your payment method for WhatsApp Business expires soon. Update to avoid service interruption...
emails.content:
Dear valued customer,

We're reaching out to inform you that your payment method for WhatsApp Business Premium will expire on February 25, 2024.

To ensure uninterrupted service, please update your payment information before the expiration date.

üí≥ Payment Method Expiring

Card ending in ****4327 expires 02/25/2024

Update your payment method securely:

Update payment information

If you don't update by the expiration date, your account will be downgraded to the free tier and some features may be limited.

Thank you for choosing WhatsApp Business,
WhatsApp Billing Team

This email was sent regarding your WhatsApp Business account. For support, contact us through the app.
headers: SPF: fail (whatsapp.com does not designate 198.51.100.15 as permitted sender)
emails.explanation: This phishing email targets business users with payment urgency. WhatsApp Business billing notifications typically come through the app, not email with external payment links.

attachments.name: payment_invoice.pdf
attachments.content:
WhatsApp Business

Payment Method

Service Features

Important: Update your payment method before February 25, 2024 to continue enjoying WhatsApp Business Premium features.

emails.subject: Account activity summary - January 2024
emails.preview: Your monthly WhatsApp usage report is available. 2,547 messages sent this month...
emails.content:
Hi,

Here's your WhatsApp activity summary for January 2024.

üìä Your Activity

  • ‚Ä¢ Messages sent: 2,547
  • ‚Ä¢ Media shared: 445 files
  • ‚Ä¢ Voice messages: 67
  • ‚Ä¢ Video calls: 23 minutes

Your data is private and encrypted. This summary is generated locally on your device and helps you understand your usage patterns.

To manage your privacy settings, go to WhatsApp Settings ‚Üí Account ‚Üí Privacy.

Thanks for using WhatsApp,
The WhatsApp Team

This email is sent monthly and contains only aggregated data. Your individual messages remain private and encrypted.
headers: SPF: pass (whatsapp.com designates 192.0.2.10 as permitted sender)
emails.explanation: Legitimate monthly activity summary. Contains only general usage statistics and directs users to in-app settings rather than external links.
